This is the first map of the whole area, and it was created in 1798, when the Prussian government ordered a cadastral survey of the country. The purpose of the survey was to collect taxes more efficiently.
The map shows the original land divisions, which were based on the property rights of the nobility, the church, and the peasants. The land was divided into parcels, each with its own unique number, according to the cadastral survey. These numbers are the same as those used in the tax assessment of the time.
The map also reveals the layout of the villages, towns, and roads in the region. It shows how the landscape was organized before the industrial revolution and urbanization began to reshape it.
